page.title: 01ESKMEALS RESERVE
page.content: The dunes at Eskmeals cover an area of 125 acres and are managed as a nature reserve by the Cumbria Trust for Nature Conservation.They constitute one of the few remaining unspoiled sand dune systems in Britain. Visitors are welcome but are encouraged to keep away from certain areas during nesting time.Birds breeding there include Black-headed Gull and Oyster-Catcher. Pools have been built to encourage the breeding of Natterjack Toads - a threatened species-also known as the "Singing Toad". Plants found include Adder's Tongue, Royal Fern and several species of orchid. The dunes are "managed" by careful control of invasive plants such as Rose-bay Willow-herb and by planting of Marram grass to encourage dune stabilisation.
